borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The scale and
massing of the single storey front extension would result in a loss of the
existing car parking space to the front of the dwellinghouse. Given that the
surrounding roads are in the Controlled Parking Zone (CPZ) and the application
is not supported by a Lambeth Transport Parking Survey Methodology (Residential
Developments), to demonstrate that the CPZ does not suffer from parking stress
and that there is room on the roads to park additional car/s, there is a
concern that the proposal would result in parking stress.&nbsp;The proposed development is therefore contrary to</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-indent: -18pt;">National
Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021);</span></li><li><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-indent: -18pt;">Policy
BR9 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011); and</span></li><li><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-indent: -18pt;">Policy
DMT 1 of the Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (December 2021).</span></li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Cumulatively,
the proposed development would result in overdevelopment on the site and it
would subsume significant amount of the site curtilage and results in excessive
infilling of the available and usable private amenity space that is available
to current and future residents. Whilst policies of the development plan allow
for properties to be extended, greater weight is placed on the need to require
developments to respond to the character of the area, and to ensure that future
occupants have an acceptable quality of living accommodation.</span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"> The proposed development is therefore contrary to:<o:p></o:p></span></p>











<ul><li style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">National Planning
Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);</span><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;,serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-fareast-language:EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Policies D4 and D6 of
the London Plan (March 2021);</span><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
&quot;Times New Roman&quot;,serif;mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-fareast-language:
EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Policies CP2 and CP3
of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</span><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;,serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-fareast-language:EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Policies BP2 and BP11
of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document
(DPD) (March 2011);</span><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;,serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-fareast-language:EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Policies SP2, DMD1,
DMD4 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan:
(Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021</span><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">);</span><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
&quot;Times New Roman&quot;,serif;mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-fareast-language:
EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</span><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;,serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-fareast-language:EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></span></li></ul>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The
scale, massing, and design of the part single/part two storey rear extension is
considered to dominate the rear elevation of the dwellinghouse, and
it&nbsp;would fail to respect the proportions of the original dwellinghouse,
resulting in undue harm in terms of character and appearance to the dwellinghouse
and the wider Becontree area which is a non-designated heritage asset. The
proposed development is therefore contrary to:</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework
(NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);</span></li><li><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></li><li><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core
Strategy (July 2010);</span></li><li><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Policies BP2 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough
Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</span></li><li><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021</span><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">);</span></li><li><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning
Document (February 2012).</span></li></ul>
description: Construction of a part single /part two storey rear extension, construction of a single storey rear infill extension, construction of a single storey front extension with porch and construction of a rear dormer extension including four roof lights to the front to facilitate conversion of roof space into habitable accommodation.
